intro: Solenidiopsis koechliniana, commonly known as the velvetleaf sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in the summer months. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Solenidiopsis koechliniana is often used as a forage crop due to its high nutritional value for livestock.
